titlestmt.titleproper: Collection of Bookplates by J. Winfred Spenceley
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Molly E. Dotson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday February 6, 2019 at 00:00

did.unittitle: Collection of Bookplates by J. Winfred Spenceley
did.abstract: This collection contains over 200 ex-libris designs by J. Winfred Spenceley (1865-1908), an artist and engraver active during the so-called "golden age" of American bookplate design.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Yale Bookplate Collection was formerly housed in Sterling Memorial Library. The collection was incorporated into the Arts of the Book Collection in 1984 and then moved to the Seeley G. Mudd Library in 1990. In 2011, it was transferred to the Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of Bookplates by J. Winfred Spenceley, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was removed from filing cabinets which housed the Pearson-Lowenhaupt Collection of English and American Bookplates. It includes materials also indicating the provenance of Irene D. Andrews Pace as well as Joseph Manuel Andreini.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: J. Winfred Spenceley (1865-1908) was born in Boston, MA, and died in Chocorua, NH. He was trained in lettering and ornamental design for steel and copper plate engraving and worked as a bank note engraver and commercial illustrator. He moved from Boston to Chicago and even to Mexico City, before returning to Boston and focusing on bookplates. Spenceley produced over 200 ex-libris designs in addition to a variety of other commercial and fine art engravings.
Reference: Joseph Manuel Andreini, J. Winfred Spenceley: His Etchings and Engravings in the Form of Bookplates (New York: Privately Printed, 1910), 11.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains over 200 ex-libris designs by J. Winfred Spenceley (1865-1908), an artist and engraver active during the so-called "golden age" of American bookplate design. In addition to ex-libris, the collection includes signed artist's proofs, trial proofs, restrikes, and original sketches for both bookplates as well as other works. The collection also includes correspondence and printed ephemera – both by and about Spenceley – from a variety of sources.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Bookplates – Numbered. II. Bookplates – Unnumbered. III. Bookplates – Unidentified. IV. Other Works. V. Correspondence and Ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged numerically by checklist number – roughly chronological in order. Any correspondence or ephemeral materials relating to a specific bookplate are filed together with the bookplate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes bookplates #1-#217 by Spenceley, which are identified and numbered according to the descriptive checklist published by Andreini in 1910. Patrons for whom Spenceley created multiple bookplates are indicated with Roman numerals, according to the convention employed by Andreini.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a description, or blazon, of the coat of arms.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes notes from Spenceley biography published in the Ex Libris Journal , vol. VIII.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two letters from Prescott. Also, one of the seals depicted is Harvard's.

did.unittitle: #24 Henry Sargent Codman and Philip Codman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the Boston Public Library memorial bookplate for Henry Sargent Codman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an etching by F. T. Merrill for which Spenceley executed the lettering.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter, dated 1949, from Frank S. Hatch to Irene D. Andrews Pace, regarding the exchange of Spenceley bookplates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes part of a letter, dated 1939, from James R. Garfield.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note describing the location of the landscape depicted in the bookplate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note stating that the artist is Charles R. Lamb, and the etcher is Spenceley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter, dated 1948, from Albert C. Bates to Frank S. Hatch, indicating that Bates never accepted Spenceley's design. See also Folder 48.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See also Folder 47.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note by Spenceley stating that E. D. French completed about half of this etching and then requested Spenceley's help to finish it, excepting the Hermes bust featured in the lower left of the design. This folder contains a proof of the plate as Spenceley left it as well as a finished print by French.

scopecontent.p: Includes a note describing in detail the Paris scene depicted in the bookplate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a letter, dated 1908, from Ms. Dixon to Mr. J. M. Andreini.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an original drawing for this bookplate design.

scopecontent.p: Includes a note explaining that the bookplate features the names of 13 famous libraries and of five bibliographers.

scopecontent.p: Includes a note with a description, or blazon, of the coat of arms as well as a brief biography of Weeks.

scopecontent.p: Includes a letter, dated 1950, from Frank S. Hatch to Irene D. Andrews Pace.

scopecontent.p: Bookplate commemorating "A Gift to the City of Keene, New Hampshire, in memory of George Silsbee Hale, by his sons Robert Sever Hale and Richard Walden Hale."

scopecontent.p: Includes a note stating that Palmer was a famous collector of rare ferns and evergreens and that his home is named "Fernwood."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note explaining that the design was based on an 18th-century plate by Fiquet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: #137 Sunday School, First Presbyterian Church, Chicago

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a poem in 3 stanzas, "In Memoriam J. W. S.," by E. C., undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an obituary of James, dated June 1941, and a version of this bookplate entitled, "Wanderings of Aloha" – Aloha being the name of James's yacht.

did.unittitle: #145 Library of the University of Michigan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two of the bookplates are mounted on an advertisement from Dodd, Mead and Company, Stationery Department. In addition to Spenceley's design, the pamphlet also includes a reproduction of one of the earliest known bookplates, that of Hildebrand Brandenburg (circa 1470-1480).

did.unittitle: #148 E. L. W. - W. M. S.[mith]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bookplate of Susan E. Parsons Forbes.

did.unittitle: #162 Georgia Medora Lee & Georgia Medora Preston
#168 Charles Henry Deere and Mary Little Dickinson Deere

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note explaining the various Mexican and Central American subjects depicted in this bookplate.

did.unittitle: #183 Eleanor Whitney Watson & #184 Margery Willard Watson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bookplate was designed by M. D. Bisbee and engraved by Spenceley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note stating that the plate was unfinished at the time of Spenceley's death and was retouched, vignetted, lettered, and refinished by Sidney L. Smith, after designs by Andreini.

did.unittitle: #204 Washington County Free Library, Hagerstown, MD
#209 The Reading Club, St. Matthew's School

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note stating that the plate was unfinished at the time of Spenceley's death and was retouched, vignetted, lettered, and refinished by Sidney L. Smith, after designs by Andreini.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bookplate of J. M. Andreini. Includes a note stating that the plate was unfinished at the time of Spenceley's death and was retouched, vignetted, lettered, and refinished by Sidney L. Smith, after designs by Andreini.

did.unittitle: #214 Wisteria Cottage Press - Zella Allen Dixon

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the name of the patron.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes unnumbered bookplates which were identified in Andreini's checklist either as "not in use as book plates" or as "unfinished coppers."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bookplate features the coat of arms of Archbishop O'Connell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note stating that the plate was unfinished at the time of Spenceley's death and later completed by A. N. Macdonald.

did.unittitle: Frank Wilkinson Darling and Mary Gorton Darling

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note stating that this was an unfinished plate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a note stating that the unfinished plate was in possession of Mrs. Spenceley and was printed in 1909.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a reproduction of Spenceley's original drawing for this bookplate, of which only the seal of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York was engraved.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a reproduction of Spenceley's reduced design, which was never completed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two trial proofs which were pulled in 1909.

did.unittitle: Society of Mayflower Descendants in Massachusetts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a trial proof pulled in 1909.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This J. W. S. design was started by Spenceley and completed by Sidney L. Smith as a memorial bookplate.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by the name of the patron with a group of unidentified materials at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes bookplates that have been attributed to Spenceley by various bookplate collectors, although none of the materials are identified in Andreini's checklist. The series also contains some trial proof plates as well as a bookplate designed for Spenceley by Herbert Gregson in 1902.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains plates for the following: Bell, Bishop's House (Springfield, MA), Anne M. H. Brewster, Traver Briscoe, Charles Scribner's Sons Stationery Department, Harvard College Library, John Gerard Heckscher, Arthur Curtiss James, Georgia Medora Lee, George Barr McCutcheon, Norman Williams Public Library, Walter Conway Prescott, Spenceley, Suffolk Club, Albert May Todd, University Club, Samuel Wilde, Sarah Gilbert Wood, unidentified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes examples of other engravings and etchings by Spenceley, most of which are not directly related to bookplates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a variety of plates and trial proofs by Spenceley, most of which are commercial illustrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a series of landscape prints, all annotated with the name "Estelle." Spenceley created nature studies to illustrate a book by Marcus Blakey Allmond (1851-1909), called Estelle: An Idyl of Old Virginia, and Other Poems .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes various states of landscape prints, belonging to a numbered series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes plates and trial proofs of various landscapes prints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes various states of mostly decorative illustrations. Also includes original drawings by Spenceley for printing ornaments and initial capitals on a galley proof folio from Voyage autor de ma chambre .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes a variety of correspondence and ephemera either by or about Spenceley, such as exhibition announcements, business announcements, correspondence regarding bookplate commissions, later correspondence regarding the collecting of Spenceley works, as well as original sketches and tracings by the artist.

did.unittitle: Various Correspondence and Lists, Notations & Postcards, etc. Also Sketches, Tracings, etc.
Additional Correspondence and Ephemera by or about Spenceley
Notes on Series I, III, IV, and V

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes handwritten lists which identify and describe some of the materials in Series I, III, IV, and V of this collection.
